speaker: Skyline
text: A blimp flies over the city.   _Scene One - Lilith's Home Freddie is seated at the table, writing.  Lilith stands near a bookcase, going through a file drawer._

speaker: Lilith
text: Here we are.  File A, slide sheet 1, image 1 of subject Frederick G. Crane.

speaker: Freddie
text: Mom!

speaker: Lilith
text: [_showing him the slide sheet_] Here you are, just an hour after being wrestled from my grudging womb.

speaker: Freddie
text: Gross!

speaker: Lilith
text: You know, if you'd like there's still time to include this in your Bar Mitzvah video.

speaker: Freddie
text: Thanks, but I just want to get through this thing with as little humiliation as possible.

speaker: Lilith
text: [_going through a box_] Oh, look at this!  Your hospital cap. The very combed cotton that swaddled your little...[_voice breaking_] head. _Lilith's emotional reaction is very minor, but somehow, for her it seems big._

speaker: Freddie
text: Are you okay?

speaker: Lilith
text: Of course I am.  It's only natural that there should be some emotional upheaval caused by the impending shift in our relationship.  I knew it would come, I just wasn't expecting such a roller coaster. [_She pauses briefly._] All done.  Is this your guest list?  Oh, I didn't realize you wanted to invite so many friends.  I don't even know some of these people.  And why are you inviting Jeremy Berman?  I thought you told me he's the biggest nerd in your class.

speaker: Freddie
text: He's not so bad.  Besides, the more people you invite, the more presents you get.

speaker: Lilith
text: Frederick... a Bar Mitzvah is a rite of passage, not an opportunity for you to collect presents.

speaker: Freddie
text: I'm sorry.  You're right.  I'll try to trim it down. _SMASH CUT TO:  Scene Two -- KACL Frasier is walking down the hall.  Kenny approaches. _

speaker: Kenny
text: Hey, Doc!

speaker: Frasier
text: Kenny.

speaker: Kenny
text: I can't tell you how touched I am that Freddie invited me to his Bar Mitzvah.

speaker: Frasier
text: He did?

speaker: Kenny
text: Yeah!  What a great kid!  That's your son, right?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.  I wasn't aware that you two had met.

speaker: Kenny
text: We haven't.  Eh, I guess he's probably heard his share of Kenny stories.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_chuckling_] Yeah.  From whom?

speaker: Kenny
text: You sly kidder.  It sounds like a hoot, but if I don't find someone to drive with me to Boston and share a tent on the way, I probably won't be able to afford to go.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hmm.

speaker: Kenny
text: Fun drive, I bet.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_nodding_] Hmm.

speaker: Kenny
text: I guess I can just send him something.

speaker: Frasier
text: I think he'd like that.  Thanks, Kenny. _Frasier taps him on the shoulder and goes to enter the studio. Another employee, Jason (who just happens to have appeared in a much larger role in episode[[9.05]](/frasier/transcripts/season_9/episode_5/love_stinks.html "Love Stinks") "Love Stinks"), approaches. _

speaker: Jason
text: [_holding an invitation envelope_] Hey, Dr. Crane!  Mazel Tov! _Frasier nods and enters the booth.  FADE OUT  Scene Three - KACL Roz comes into the studio from her booth._

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hey, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Freddie's so sweet.  He sent me an invitation to his Bar Mitzvah. [_She produces the invitation._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, apparently the people of Washington state have made quite an impression on him.

speaker: Roz
text: Can you believe Freddie is thirteen years old already?  [_N.B. This is now Frederick's correct age.  Freddie was born in November 1989, but in "Good Samaritan" he had suddenly aged a couple of years.  In "Cranes Unplugged," Freddie is said to be thirteen. Now it seems the writers have realized their mistake and returned Freddie to the right age._]

speaker: Frasier
text: I can hardly think about it without choking up.  This is my son, Roz.  The little bald candy man that used to fit right here in the crook of my arm.

speaker: Roz
text: [_sweetly, teasing_] "Little bald candy man."  That's adorable. I had a boyfriend who called hi...

speaker: Roz
text: [_recovers_] Is it weird to have a son brought up in a different religion from yours?

speaker: Frasier
text: Not at all, Roz.  It's a faith that espouses love, compassion, duty, education, and art.  All values which I cherish.  And though I have played a relatively small role in his spiritual development, he has honored me by asking that I say a few words.  And in the spirit of the occasion, I'm going to try to learn it in Hebrew.

speaker: Noel
text: Hi, Dr. Crane!

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi, Noel.

speaker: Noel
text: Hi, Roz.  You've never worn that sweater on a Tuesday before.

speaker: Roz
text: I've asked you to take your hands out of your pockets when you talk to me.

speaker: Noel
text: So, I don't think I can make the Bar Mitzvah.

speaker: Frasier
text: Great. [_recovering_] I mean that sarcastically, of course, Noel. [_feigning disappointment_] Great!  You're not coming, terrific!

speaker: Noel
text: Yeah, sorry.  Did I overhear you say you want to learn Hebrew?

speaker: Frasier
text: Not learn it, I'm saving that pleasure for retirement.  But I have composed a speech and I-I'd like to say it in Hebrew.

speaker: Noel
text: Well, I can translate and teach you how to say it if you want.

speaker: Frasier
text: You can, really, oh, Noel, thank you!

speaker: Noel
text: Of course, I'll expect a little something quid pro quo.

speaker: Frasier
text: Certainly, whatever you'd like.

speaker: Noel
text: Great!  The Seattle _Star Trek_ convention is this weekend, and all the _Enterprise_ captains are making an appearance. I need Scott Bakula's autograph to make my collection complete.

speaker: Frasier
text: Noel, isn't this something you could do yourself?

speaker: Noel
text: I would, but William Shatner's restraining order against me is still in effect.  It's so stupid.  It wasn't even a real phaser.  [_N.B. The first reference to this restraining order is made in[[6.13]](/frasier/transcripts/season_6/episode_13/the_show_where_woody_shows_up.html "The Show Where Woody Shows Up"), "The Show Where Woody Comes Back."_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Noel, don't you have any friends that could do this for you?

speaker: Noel
text: Trust me, there are no friends in the world of _Star Trek_ autography.

speaker: Frasier
text: I see.  Well, then, consider it done.

speaker: Noel
text: Well, thank you so much! _He opens his backpack and gets a publicity photo of Bakula in his garb as Captain Archer._

speaker: Frasier
text: Now, be sure to keep it in this acid-free covering until the actual signing, and if you must handle it, use these cotton gloves.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_taking them_] Okay.

speaker: Noel
text: You'll be the hit of the Bar Mitzvah, I promise.  And don't be surprised if you get caught up in the fun of the convention, too.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_patiently_] Yeah, I'll try to pace myself.

speaker: Noel
text: Thanks again, Dr. Crane.

speaker: Frasier
text: Noel!  How did you know I would do it?

speaker: Noel
text: What do you mean?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you must have known I would do this for you, or you wouldn't be carrying around a picture of Scott Bakula, right?

speaker: Noel
text: [_playing along, but confused_] Right. _He exits.  FADE TO:  Scene Four - Frasier's apartment Niles is seated on the couch.  Martin enters carrying a massive, antiquated dinosaur of a flash camera._

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Niles, think fast! _He flashes the camera, which produces a bright, blinding light, knocking Niles over._

speaker: Niles
text: Dad! _The camera makes a high-pitched electronic sound of recovery in the wake of the giant flash.  Daphne enters from the kitchen._

speaker: Daphne
text: What is that?

speaker: Martin
text: My good old Scheerblad-7X-K.

speaker: Niles
text: The blindingest, noisiest, fifteen-pound camera ever produced in the former Soviet Union!

speaker: Martin
text: Can you believe it?  Somehow it got buried deep down in storage.  But, Eddie and I found it just in time for the Bar Mitzvah.

speaker: Daphne
text: What smells like burning plastic?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, that means the flash unit's working.

speaker: Niles
text: [_still blinking it off_] I thought the retina-scorching flash meant that the flash unit was working.

speaker: Martin
text: Not always.

speaker: Niles
text: I still remember the night of my junior prom.  Dad wanted to get a nice close-up of me and Margaret Coover.  Unfortunately he got a little too close and the heat from the flash seared the gold plating off Margaret's necklace onto her skin.

speaker: Daphne
text: You never mentioned Margaret Coover before.

speaker: Niles
text: I didn't?  Margaret Coover.  Petite, brunette, gilded. _Frasier enters, whereupon he is immediately greeted by the flash and the high squeal.  He is thrown back against the door, blinking and disoriented._

speaker: Frasier
text: Dear God, the old flash-and-whine!

speaker: Niles
text: [_deadpan_] Dad found it.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, good thing, too.  Hasn't failed me yet.  Oh, except for that one Thanksgiving when the flash washed Lilith out so bad all you could see were her hair and eyes.

speaker: Frasier
text: That wasn't the camera's fault, Dad.  That bloodless skin has confounded even the most experienced photographer.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Daph, do you know where the tripod is?  I might need it for group shots.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah, I think it's in the back of your closet.  Come on, I'll help you look for it. _Martin rises, with the camera around his neck.  As he attempts to stand, the camera's weight pulls him down and he almost falls forward. He walks hunched over after Daphne._

speaker: Niles
text: Sherry, Frasier?

speaker: Frasier
text: Please, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: I have good news.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hmm?

speaker: Niles
text: I have two tickets to the Udo Fritzenheim show at the museum tomorrow, not to mention an invitation for lunch with the artist afterwards.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_excited_] Oh, are you serious, Niles?  Lunch with a Dada master!  Oh, I'd love to come!  But I can't.  I have other plans.  I promised Noel Shempsky I'd do a favor for him and I've got to remain true to my word.  Although perhaps I could go to the show, leave the luncheon early and still fulfill my commitment.

speaker: Niles
text: [_handing him the sherry_] Oh yes, of course you could.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah, you're right, Niles.  There. [_They toast._] You know, it was at a Fritzenheim show in Boston where Freddie first said the word "Dada."  I remember swelling with pride thinking that perhaps he was an art history savant, but of course Lilith deflated my enthusiasm by pointing out that he was probably just referring to me.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Fras, good news, found the tripod.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, splendid.

speaker: Martin
text: It's tough to watch your kids grow up.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, he's... still just a boy.  He's only thirteen.

speaker: Martin
text: [_tapping his shoulder_] It goes fast.

speaker: Daphne
text: How's Lilith taking it?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I suppose it's a bittersweet experience for her. I can't really say for sure.  You know, she's always been rather guarded with her emotions.

speaker: Niles
text: Not always, Frasier, I've seen her get quite emotional.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sure you have, Mr. Been-There-Done-That.

speaker: Daphne
text: What does that mean? _Frasier, Martin, and Niles are all taken aback and look at each other uncomfortably.  All together, they say "Nothing."_

speaker: Daphne
text: [_to Niles_] What are you hiding?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh... [_he struggles at length for words_] Um... some years ago...

speaker: Frasier
text: In a complete drunken stupor...

speaker: Martin
text: Totally stinko...

speaker: Niles
text: Yes... I had an unplanned, uh, and instantly regretted, uh, night of amore... with Lilith.

speaker: Daphne
text: A one-nighter?

speaker: Niles
text: [_stupidly_] Of amore. [_N.B. This was the major event of "Room Service," listed above._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Lilith?!

speaker: Niles
text: Well, it was after Maris, and long before you.  In fact, it's pretty funny when you think about it.

speaker: Niles
text: And remember, I was drunk.

speaker: Daphne
text: You'd have to be, wouldn't you? [_realizing_] Oh, sorry, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh no, drinking definitely took the edge off.

speaker: Daphne
text: And when were you planning on sharing this interesting bit of information with me?

speaker: Niles
text: Soon... very soon... never.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well... what's done is done.  I suppose we've all had our romantic missteps.  But just to be clear: are there any more secret sweethearts who I see on a regular basis?

speaker: Niles
text: No.  Nobody. [_looking to Frasier for confirmation_] Nobody? [_Frasier nods_] Nobody.

speaker: Frasier
text: I certainly wouldn't count Anamari Hanratty at the Natural History Museum.

speaker: Niles
text: [_with quivering, pleading voice_] Frasier?

speaker: Frasier
text: I said I _wouldn't_ count her.  I mean, they just made out. _Daphne glares at Niles again.  Frasier quickly tries to recover and grabs a book from the coffee table._

speaker: Frasier
text: It was for charity!  But it doesn't really matter, I mean, the woman makes out with everyone. [_He places the book on the television_] You see, she's not really the kind of person that you'd... _He has eased himself to Martin's camera and quickly flashes it, blinding all three of them.  Martin screams.  Frasier takes the opportunity to quickly run out the door.  FADE TO:  Scene Five - KACL Frasier is entering the studio as Noel catches up to him._

speaker: Noel
text: Hi, Dr. Crane.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi, Noel.

speaker: Noel
text: Are you ready for _yeshiva_ tomorrow?  That means "school."

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes indeed, I am, I'm looking forward to it.  Uh, listen, Noel, I'm afraid I have some bad news about the, uh, science fiction convention.

speaker: Noel
text: Uh-oh!

speaker: Frasier
text: Long story short, you see, I attended an art opening and a luncheon on Saturday, and even though I left the luncheon early the traffic on the way to the convention was just awful and by the time I got there, Mr. Bakula and all the others had gone.

speaker: Noel
text: [_deeply distressed_] No...!  You made a promise and you welshed on it!  Why'd you do it, Dr. Crane?

speaker: Frasier
text: It's not really such a big deal is it, Noel?

speaker: Noel
text: It's a _huge_ deal!  Who knows when I'll get to see Scott Bakula again?  I'll be the laughingstock of my clan!

speaker: Frasier
text: Noel, try to remem... clan?  No, never mind, never mind! Noel, surely you realize that _Star Trek_ is just a TV show.

speaker: Noel
text: So was _Brideshead Revisited_!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_furious, then_] You're angry, so I'm going to ignore that. But with all due respect, Noel, perhaps weaning yourself off science fiction might be the first step toward achieving a genuine, meaningful, grownup person's life! [_realizing his voice has risen_] Just a friendly suggestion.

speaker: Noel
text: You're right.  You did your best and that's good enough for me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you, Noel.  So, you'll still be my tutor?

speaker: Noel
text: Sure.

speaker: Frasier
text: Good man. Thank you. [_tapping his shoulder_] I'll see you tomorrow.

speaker: Noel
text: [_menacingly_] Oh, yes, you will see me tomorrow.  And by the rings of Septaurus Five you will pay, Dr. Crane.  You... [_he stops as Kenny walks by_] Oh hi, Kenny! ...will pay! _FADE OUT  END OF ACT ONE  ACT TWO  Scene Six - KACL Roz is with Eddie in her booth, "showing" him the controls._

speaker: Roz
text: Okay, Eddie, hit the "talk" button. [_Eddie does so._] And you're listening to "The Best of Crane" on KACL.  We'll be back after these messages.

speaker: Noel
text: Well, well.  The fox and the hound working together.  How ironic.

speaker: Roz
text: I'm just taking care of him until Frasier gets back from Boston.  By the way, he left you something. _She grabs a large package from under the counter.  It looks like a tall hatbox._

speaker: Noel
text: He did?

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah. _Noel opens the package.  He pulls out what appears to be a "Certificate of Authenticity, and then a black wig on a dummy head.  Noel appears thrilled with this gift._

speaker: Roz
text: Wow.  A wig?  That's cruel even for Frasier.

speaker: Noel
text: Cruel?  It's only the wig Joan Collins wore in _Star Trek_ Twenty-Eight, "City on the Edge of Forever."  It's probably still got her DNA in it.

speaker: Roz
text: [_reading Frasier's note_] "Dear Noel.  I hope this begins to repay you for your great kindness to me, especially in light of my negligence.  Your friend, Frasier Crane."

speaker: Noel
text: He called me "friend"?

speaker: Roz
text: That's really sweet of him.

speaker: Noel
text: I've got to call him before he delivers his speech.

speaker: Roz
text: You taught him dirty words in Hebrew, didn't you?

speaker: Noel
text: Uh, not quite.  They're the same words, but they're in Klingon.

speaker: Roz
text: From _Star Trek_?  That's not even real.

speaker: Noel
text: It's the fastest growing language on the planet!  This is what you people don't understand. [_becoming passionate_] A man named Gene Roddenberry had a vision...

speaker: Roz
text: CALL HIM! _Noel dials.  FADE TO:_ **STAR MITZVAH** _Scene Seven - A synagogue in Boston. Frederick is chanting in Hebrew at the lectern._

speaker: Freddie
text: _Yit-ba-rach shim-cha bi'fi kol chai.  Tamid l'o-lam va-ed. Ba-ruch a-tah, A-do-nai.  M'ka-deish ha-Sha-bat. Amen._ _Frasier and Lilith are shown sitting together, beaming.  Rabbi Gendler, who is administering the ceremony, rises and congratulates Frederick._

speaker: Gendler
text: _Yasher Koach_ Frederick.  That was a beautiful passage, and a wonderful reading.  You honor us all by including... _Frasier's cell phone rings.  Embarrassed, he turns it off.  We see that Daphne, Niles, and Martin are seated next to Frasier.  Frasier, Niles, and Martin are wearing yarmulkes, while Lilith has a hat on._

speaker: Gendler
text: You honor us all by including us in this important occasion, but you have chosen to especially honor your parents, Lilith and Frasier, by asking them to conclude this ceremony. Lilith?

speaker: Lilith
text: Thank you.  I... _Martin's camera flash goes off, blinding Lilith, Freddie, and the Rabbi._

speaker: Gendler
text: Excuse me, would the photographer please refrain from taking any more pictures until after the ceremony is over?

speaker: Martin
text: Sorry, Rabbi.

speaker: Lilith
text: Thank you.  I am very proud to participate in the coming-of- age ritual of my son, Frederick Gaylord Crane. _A boy laughs at this, interrupting.  Clearly, this is the Jeremy Berman of whom Freddie and Lilith had spoken earlier._

speaker: Jeremy
text: [_catching himself_] Oh.

speaker: Lilith
text: Frederick, on this momentous occasion, I can only look at you and see that innocent, chubby-legged toddler who once danced naked at the Boston Pops... the little boy whose favorite dish was "buh-sghetti."

speaker: Lilith
text: I can't count the number of bedtimes we spent cuddled together reading _The Cat in the Hat._

speaker: Lilith
text: "The sun did not shine.  It was too wet to play, so we sat in the house on that cold, cold wet day." _Frasier is also bemused by Lilith's antics.  Lilith breaks into tears. The Rabbi tries to console them._

speaker: Lilith
text: Don't grow up!  Not yet! [_She emotionally hugs Freddie._]

speaker: Daphne
text: [_to Niles_] Nice girlfriend you've got there.

speaker: Niles
text: If you're trying to embarrass me, it's not going to work. _However, that ship sails when a very emotional Martin leans across and hugs Niles._

speaker: Martin
text: Come here, Daddy's little peanut man.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_leading Lilith back to her seat_] It'll be all right.

speaker: Gendler
text: We will conclude with a blessing from Frederick's father, Frasier, who, though not of our faith, has chosen to follow his son's fine example and deliver it in Hebrew.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you. [_going to the lectern_] I'll keep this short.

speaker: Freddie
text: Thanks, Dad. _Frasier pulls out the cards for his speech and places his hand on Freddie's shoulder._

speaker: Frasier
text: _Pookh lod wih le koo.  Hach jahj cho-koov-moakh leng-lidge loo-Teb-jahj leng widge-vahd bel rahp shoave dah-nobe-poo- boagh._ [_in Hebrew_] _Shabbat shalom._ _Frasier's delivery of Klingon has just the right "accent."  In the course of the speech, the Cranes look on admiringly while the rest of the congregation is highly confused._

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, that was lovely.

speaker: Gendler
text: What was that gobbledygook?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it's-it's a blessing for my son, "_Pookh Lod Wih Le Koo._ "

speaker: Gendler
text: That means nothing.  It's gibberish.

speaker: Frasier
text: What?

speaker: Jeremy
text: That's not gibberish.  It's Klingon.

speaker: Gendler
text: What?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, dear God!

speaker: Jeremy
text: Freddie's Dad just blessed him in Klingon.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_mortified_] I'm terribly sorry.  I... I... will you excuse me, please? _He quickly runs out of the hall.  Everybody, including the Rabbi, can't contain their amusement._

speaker: Gendler
text: Okay, everybody.  It's better to end with laughter than tears. I don't know how they say it in outer space, but here we say [_putting his hands toward Freddie's head_] _ahava_ and _shalom_ - Love and Peace.  Dinner will be served in the multi-purpose room in twenty minutes.

speaker: Jeremy
text: Hey that was awesome, _Gaylord._

speaker: Freddie
text: Shut up, Berman.

speaker: Jeremy
text: Seriously, your dad's Klingon is really good.

speaker: Freddie
text: What did he say?

speaker: Jeremy
text: Well, roughly translated, it says, "My dearest son, each day you redeem me.  May your journey be filled with the same joy, wisdom, and purpose you have given mine."  It's a lot more beautiful in the original Klingon, but it's still really cool.

speaker: Lilith
text: Which one of us do you suppose humiliated him more?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I think I did.  I've been trying to console myself with the idea that without embarrassing parents, there'd be no psychology.  Poor kid.

speaker: Lilith
text: Actually, today he is a man.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_putting his arm around her_] He is, isn't he?

speaker: Gendler
text: [_approaching them and taking their hands_] _Mazel Tov_. You must be very proud - of your son, not yourselves.

speaker: Lilith
text: [_as he exits_] We are, thank you, Rabbi.

speaker: Frasier
text: Frederick, uh, listen, I-I'm-I want to apologize.  Uh, there was this guy at the radio station.  He was going to teach me Hebrew...

speaker: Freddie
text: You don't have to explain it, Dad.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?  I just wanted to tell you how sorry I am.

speaker: Freddie
text: Berman translated your speech for me.  It was pretty good.

speaker: Frasier
text: So you liked it?

speaker: Freddie
text: Yeah.  I don't want to get all mushy or anything - I'm a little old for that now, but... you know.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah, I know. [_they embrace_]

speaker: Lilith
text: Can you forgive me?

speaker: Freddie
text: Yeah, for everything but naming me "Gaylord." [_they hug_]

speaker: Niles
text: [_approaching_] That was lovely. _Niles moves to embrace Lilith.  Daphne steps in his way and hugs Lilith before Niles can get to her._

speaker: Martin
text: [_offstage_] Hey everybody, look this way!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, no, no...! _The flash and high-pitched squeal follow, and the frame freezes with the whited-out faces of Niles, Daphne, Lilith, Frasier, and Freddie, shielding themselves from the blinding light.  FADE OUT  END OF ACT TWO_
